properties.areaDesc: Northern Humboldt Interior; Northeastern Mendocino Interior; Southern Humboldt Interior
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 15 at 4:00PM PST until January 16 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Eureka CA
properties.description:
...HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY...

.A significant winter storm is expected to impact the region this
evening through Thursday, with widespread heavy mountain snow
accumulations likely. Snow levels are expected to fall from 3500
to nearly 2000 feet early Thursday morning, which will bring heavy
snow accumulations to numerous interior mountain highways,
including Highways 299, 199, 36, and 3, in addition to numerous
rural roadways. In addition, accumulating small hail will be
possible across coastal areas late Wednesday night into Thursday.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 2500 feet. 8 to 24 inches of
snow expected at elevations over 3000 feet. Snow accumulations
of 3 to 9 inches possible down to 2500 feet. Snow levels will
fall from 3500 feet this afternoon to 2500 feet or slightly
lower tonight. Gusty south winds at the onset of the snow will
diminish quickly overnight.

* WHERE...Interior Humboldt and northeastern Mendocino counties,
including highways 299 over Berry Summit and 36 as Southfork
Mountain.

* WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 4 PM PST Thursday. The
heaviest snow is expected this evening and overnight Humboldt
County. Heavy snow will likely continue into Thursday morning
in northern Mendocino County.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The
hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening
commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state of California can be
obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THURSDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET
